body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Assume creature A on the battlefield
2. Assume creature B in the graveyard
3. Play recurring nightmare What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Lands are tapped, creature A is sacrificed as part of the cost.
Now creature A and B are in the graveyard, so you can put
creature A in play again.

This should happend the other way around. MTG rules require all
targets to be selected before the spell is cast. After activating
recurring nightmare you should be presented with the list of 
creatures from your graveyard, then tap the lands, and finally
ask for a creature to sacrifice. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Magarena 1.24 on Ubuntu 11.10
author: [pablo.ca...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/100883785716832971309/)
title: Target selection should be done before paying costs

comments.body:
Agree, choosing targets should happen before paying costs. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.

**Status:** Accepted
